svg.text: Cross-Domain Coordination with Indigenous Guidance and Democratic Accountability
1. Climate monitors detect severe flooding → 2. Health teams assess disease risks → 3. Economic teams calculate reconstruction needs
4. Cultural advocates assess heritage site impacts → 5. Peace teams coordinate displacement support → 6. Earth Council guides response
Result: Coordinated 24-hour response with Treaty taxation funding, Traditional Territory protection, and community-led recovery
Outcome: 60% faster response time, 40% better resource efficiency, 80% higher community satisfaction than fragmented approach
Success Metrics: 60% faster crisis response • 85% policy coherence • 90% Indigenous consent compliance • 75% youth satisfaction with future impact consideration
